{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3141981,"name":"Matt Brechting","username":"mfbrechting","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mfbrechting/{size}/169974_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-08T19:10:25.618Z","cooked":"

The robot Signal Light is important, but in our shop on the test chassis and old bots that aren’t leaving the shop it doesn’t seem like the Official Allen Bradley model needs to be used. Does anyone have a good substitute Part Number that is budget friendly for these applications?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-08T19:10:25.618Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":73,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":423.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426137,"topic_slug":"robot-signal-light-substitute-for-shop-bots","display_username":"Matt Brechting","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38562,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Do Justice and Watch the Sky Fall."},"post_url":"/t/robot-signal-light-substitute-for-shop-bots/426137/1","custom_user_title":"Do Justice and Watch the Sky Fall.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3141988,"name":"Jack","username":"JR0405","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jr0405/{size}/179266_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-08T19:17:17.700Z","cooked":"

Andymark’s is cheaper at $55: https://www.andymark.com/products/robot-signal-light
It is also now legal for competition

Anything that meets NI’s specs for will work. The RSL output is a 120mA max output which is either connected to your Vin voltage (~battery or regulated, nominal 12v) or disconnected.

image1184×230 8.77 KB

A couple of these might work

Alternately, Something like this - however I don’t know for sure what the current draw is.

Update. We used these that cost a dollar a piece. Slightly less visable than than the offical because of its shorter height. But is pretty much plug and play to get a offical RSL back. Incredible bang for your buck, cant rdcommend enough for practice chassis, internal robot competitions, or robots not being used regularly.

GASHER 12V/24V/110V 20mA Energy Saving Indicator Light Mounting Hole Size 22mm (7/8 Inch) Red 10 Pcs https://a.co/d/0aEKGr5
